reviews.text: You reach the hotel lobby via an elevator. There are 2 of them. No other elevators. The hotel describes itself as a penthouse hotel.
reviews.title: A Nice Stay

reviews.text: I had a very comfortable garden view room. Standard decor. Bedding a bit warm would be my only complaint. The room had wired Internet that was more than fast enough. Wireless reception in the lobby.
reviews.title: Nice decor, but just so odd.

reviews.text: I loved the heated outdoor pool on both warm and cool days. An experience to be swimming outdoors when it was about 10 degrees C. In the pool was 28.
reviews.title: Central location, prime experience

reviews.text: I attend this hotel for a 5 day conference. I will preface my remarks by saying I did not take meals at the hotel because they were quite expensive, but the facilities ave very nice, the staff extremely helpful, and the rooms very nice with free internet, cable TV, etc. Since I was on business travel for a conference at this hotel, I did not worry about the cost of lodging, only the food. However, Montreal is not an inexpensive city, and neither was the hotel.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel wih great Staff

reviews.text: Three of my friends and I stayed here for two nights this past month. The rooms were great- lots of space, very clean, comfortable beds and a great view of the city. We received a great deal on the hotel room and free breakfast because one of my friend's was a Hilton Honors member. Breakfast was delicious and there was a huge selection. Gym had all the necessary equipment and a bonus yoga room. Didn't get a chance to enjoy the heated outdoor pool but it looked good. I LOVED the outdoor garden and patio! Such a nice place to sit for a little while. Unfortunately no wifi in the rooms but the lobby had plenty of places to sit. We were just visiting for the weekend so we fully utilized the concierge on multiple occasions for information on things to do, where to go and how to get there. He was so helpful! I do wish I realized there was a Metro stop right below the hotel- but it was a gorgeous weekend and didn't mind walking. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel & Great service

reviews.text: Some may not rate this as a five star hotel, but I found it to be a very clean, very accommodating, service-oriented hotel. It is right in the middle of the action of Montreal, Quebec. The staff is terrific. Kudos to them! French is the preffered language here but at no time did I feel deficient because my French was rusty. After a while, "sortie" becomes "exit" in your mind and so on. I felt a little sorry for the front desk people; however, as they had to repeat themselves constantly (once in French, and then in English). By the way, the Club Boneventure upgrade is well worth the extra expense.
reviews.title: Very Nice!

reviews.text: At first it was a little disconcerting to arrive at your hotel only to find you needed to take an elevator just to find the reception. However, this became more of a quirk than a problem for this hotel. The location is great - 3 minutes walk from the airport bus stop, above a Metro station, over the road from the edge of the underground shopping precincts and 5 minutes walk from Rue Ste Catherine where all the larger stores are situated.
reviews.title: Central location and amazing roof garden

reviews.text: I found the rooms a reasonable size (neither too large nor too small), and the layout was definitely one of the best I have ever experienced: plenty of power outlets in convenient positions, great two-level desk arrangement; TV at an appropriate viewing distance; bar fridge below a good-sized counter containing the coffee-maker. My room had a window which opened, which meant that I could get the room nice and cool for sleeping. Even though it faced the street, I did not find the traffic noise a problem.
reviews.title: Nice hotel next to train station

reviews.text: Very modern rooms and great location to the business part of town, and great location to the train station. Could do with my internal restaurant choices but the lobby level foodery certainly did the job
reviews.title: Modern, good amenities and interesting layout

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose the Hilton Bonaventure for our recent stay in Montreal based on the glowing recommendation of a frequent flying family member. The downtown location proved to be a great starting point for our city explorations. The room was clean, well laid out, and comfortable. The staff was courteous and al spoke flawless English. One evening we decided to sample some local ice wine we had purchased, the hotel quickly brought us glasses, opened, and then served us our wine. The breakfast was delicious, and the selection at the bar was above average. The rooftop garden was beautiful, although we didn’t have time to walk though it in its entirety. Over all I give this hotel my full recommendation.
reviews.title: An elegant place to stay.

reviews.text: I travel all over the world and stay in perhaps 50 hotels a year. Outside of Asia, there are virtually no truly great hotels. Therefore it is amazing to find this gem using the Hilton brand in Montreal. It is very unusual, in that it is on one floor at the top of an old convention center. But it works great. It has free wired wifi, and it is fast and responsive. It also has free wireless in the lobby area. The pool looks great (although I'll have to wait to next time to try it personally). It is a outdoor, heated year-around pool, but you enter it from a warm room adjacent to the pool and enter the main pool through a short rectangular tunnel. The buffets in the restaurant are great. It is also incredibly convenient to Montreal's financial center, with most institutions within 100 meters. They can be accessed through underground tunnels if the weather is bad. The rooms are fine. Only one complaint: the TV's carry a lot of channels including free HBO and Cinemax, but they are piping in analog to digital TV's. Why in this day and age do hotels show such carelessness? I was there in an off-season, so it was quite inexpensive, although I am sure prices go way up at other times of the year.
reviews.title: As good as the best hotels in North America

reviews.text: This is a great hotel if you're staying here. The outdoor heated pool was fabulous, and the fitness room is great. The room was very clean and had lots of space. The free Wi-fi was very convenient as I needed access to the internet while I was there. The location is good, and it's easy to get around without having to go outside since the underground can be accessed from the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, but a little expensive

reviews.text: The concierge and reception were very helpful and knowledgeable. They recommended three great restaurants and were able to give me directions to everywhere I needed to go.
reviews.title: Great Hotel stayed for conference

reviews.text: I stayed there for 3 nights in June on a business trip. The location is perfect for train travelers -- right beside the train station and right in downtown Montreal. It's within walking distance to Old Montreal, to the shopping area, and to China town. One really doesn't need a car to explore Montreal if you stay in this hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel at the train station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The unique thing about this hotel is that, even though you are on the 22nd floor, because of the trees and other plants planted on the roof top, you feel you are right in the middle of an oasis. The room and the service all meet or exceed 4-star hotel standards. The swimming pool is at the roof top without a cover, so if you don't like to swim while it rains, it might be a problem. But the environment is very nice.
reviews.title: weekend in Montreal

reviews.text: It's expensive, but I would stay there again if someone else is paying for it :-)

reviews.title: A good central point to explore Montreal

reviews.text: We checked in during a protest due to an economic conference being held at the hotel, and wondered if this would result in a difficult stay. It's hard to relax with armed security at every corner, but fortunately our check in was seamless and simple. We arrived early, and went to the concierge for a lunch suggestion (which turned out well!). We then came back to the hotel and had a couple of drinks poolside before heading out for dinner.
reviews.title: Great location, interesting architecture

reviews.text: As a Hilton Diamond member, I had access to the Executive Lounge, and in keeping with the tradition I found it to be well stocked and maintained at all times. I especially liked the honor system cocktails - it sure made getting drinks handled much easier. My only complaint was a lack of choices in the bar area - not a bourbon or Tennessee whiskey in sight. Alas, I made do...
reviews.title: Great Hotel Not For Shopping For Kids

reviews.text: The rest of our stay was excellent. The concierges are a critical piece of this hotel for travellers, both business and leisure. The stand is right by the front desk, and usually double staffed for efficiency.
reviews.title: The place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only concerns with this hotel overall are related to parking and subway access. We valet parked at $28/day so we could take the car out multiple times, but might have self parked for $19/day and used the subway (we always prefer to use public transit when we travel). Either way, it's a little on the pricey side. The subway access is a VERY long walk through the bowels of the building to get to the station below it. Hotel management should look into improving access to the subway to improve it's versatility for vacationers.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, usual Hilton standard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been coming to this hotel since 1977. The location is perfect, the roof top swimming pool area was in full swing, very relaxing. Yes, this is a business hotel, but perfect for the family with kids as well. Worthy of note on this sweltering summer weekend was the room for sleeping, pillows were fluffy and abundant, A/C worked great, bed very comfortable, no street or hall noise, my wife and I slept very doundly. Front desk staff very accomodating.
reviews.title: Everything was excellent

reviews.text: This is an older (mid 20th century) hotel that has a lot of concrete walls and some steps (rooms are on two levels that are "split" from the lobby), but the hotel has been well maintained. Our stay was uneventful and easy; the king w/ a sofabed was a great setup for our family. The metro was a great option for sight-seeing -- kids 6 and under ride for free.

reviews.text: Typical Hilton. Good service, comfy beds, good restaurant, no surprises. I liked it a lot. Great location for sightseeing downtown as most sites and lots of good restaurants are within 10-15 minutes walking. To go further afield there's a subway just down the block and in bad weather like I had you can get to the subway without going outside though it's a bit convoluted and not well marked. I'd stay there again.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay when sightseeing in Montreal
